rdf:Description.dc:title: The life of the Moselle, from its source in the Vosges Mountains to its junction with the Rhine, at Coblence
rdf:Description.dc:creator: Octavius Rooke
Octavius Rooke
Henry Noel Humphreys (1810–1879)
Thomas Bolton (fl. 1851–1893)

rdf:Description.dc:subject: Moselle River -- Description and travel
rdf:Description.dc:description: A lovely illustrated travel-book on the river Moselle (Mosel). The author follows this river from its source near Bussang in France to Coblence (Koblenz) in Germany where it joins with the river Rhine (Rhein), and provides the reader with a lot of historical anecdotes and samples of folklore on his way.
